title: Cajun-crusted Snapper Fillets
summary: Cajun-crusted Snapper Fillets requires around 16 minutes from start to finish. For $6.16 per serving, this recipe covers 51% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. This main course has 1118 calories, 94g of protein, and 30g of fat per serving. This recipe serves 4. It is a good option if you're following a pescatarian diet. 2 people have tried and liked this recipe. It is brought to you by Allrecipes. Head to the store and pick up snapper fillets, bread crumbs, flour, and a few other things to make it today. To use up the dry bread crumbs you could follow this main course with the Gluten Free Dairy Free Coconut Tarts as a dessert. Taking all factors into account, this recipe earns a spoonacular score of 87%, which is great. Cajun-Crusted Snapper Fillets, Snapper Fillets, and Blackened Red Snapper Fillets are very similar to this recipe.

winePairing.pairingText: Pinot Grigio, Gruener Veltliner, and Pinot Noir are great choices for Fish. Fish is as diverse as wine, so it's hard to pick wines that go with every fish. A crisp white wine, such as a pinot grigio or Gr√ºner Veltliner, will suit any delicately flavored white fish. Meaty, strongly flavored fish such as salmon and tuna can even handle a light red wine, such as a pinot noir. One wine you could try is Skyfall Pinot Gris. It has 4.7 out of 5 stars and a bottle costs about 13 dollars.

productMatches.title: Skyfall Pinot Gris
productMatches.description: Pale straw in color with notes of mango, citrus blossom and banana in the nose. On the palate a medley of tropical fruit unfolds into tangerine, mango, grapefruit, and banana flavors. These tropical notes continue throughout the long and lingering finish.

instructions: Toss together bread crumbs, Cajun seasoning, and salt in a bowl.  In a separate bowl, beat the eggs with the buttermilk.  Toss the fish with the flour, shake off the excess, and dip into the egg.  Shake off excess egg, and press into breadcrumb mixture.  Set aside.                        Heat about 1/8 inch of oil in a heavy bottomed skillet over medium-high heat.  Cook for 3 to 5 minutes per side until the fish flakes easily and has browned nicely.

steps.step: Toss together bread crumbs, Cajun seasoning, and salt in a bowl.  In a separate bowl, beat the eggs with the buttermilk.  Toss the fish with the flour, shake off the excess, and dip into the egg.  Shake off excess egg, and press into breadcrumb mixture.  Set aside.
Heat about 1/8 inch of oil in a heavy bottomed skillet over medium-high heat.  Cook for 3 to 5 minutes per side until the fish flakes easily and has browned nicely.
